data.name: DataProvider_OleDB_AccessDataSource_MoreInfo
data.value: The Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0 provider cannot be used in Visual Studio because it is 32-bit only. For more information, please see https://aka.ms/VSDataProviders.

data.name: DataProvider_OleDB_SqlDataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to connect to Microsoft SQL Server 2000 or above using the .NET framework data provider for OLEDB.

data.name: OdbcConnectionUIControl_SQLDriverConnectFailed
data.value: Failed to call the ODBC driver connection utility.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_CannotModifyState
data.value: The data connection dialog state cannot be programmatically modified when the dialog is visible.

data.name: DataProvider_Mds_DataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to connect to Microsoft SQL Server and Azure SQL Database using the Microsoft SqlClient Data Provider for SQL Server. The latest Microsoft.Data.SqlClient package will be installed to the project.

data.name: SqlFileConnectionUIControl_InvalidConnectionProperties
data.value: The connection properties object must be of type SqlFileConnectionProperties.

data.value: The connection properties object must be of type OleDBConnectionProperties.

data.value: This connection cannot be tested because the specified database does not exist or is not visible to the specified user.

data.value: SqlClient

data.name: DataProvider_OleDB_AccessDataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to connect to a Microsoft Access database file through the .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB. Data connections in Visual Studio can only be made using 64-bit data providers. However, at runtime 32-bit applications can continue to use 32-bit data providers. For more information, please see https://aka.ms/VSDataProviders.

data.value: <other>

data.name: SqlFileConnectionProperties_CannotTestNonExistentMdf
data.value: This connection cannot be tested because the specified database file does not exist.

data.name: DataProvider_Odbc_DataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to specify an ODBC user or system data source name to connect to an ODBC driver through the .NET Framework Data Provider for ODBC. Data connections in Visual Studio can only be made using 64-bit data providers. However, at runtime 32-bit applications can continue to use 32-bit data providers For more information, please see https://aka.ms/VSDataProviders.

data.name: SqlFileConnectionProperties_TimeoutReasons
data.value: Common reasons for this problem include that the server is not installed, the service is not started or the server is upgrading your database. If an upgrade is in process, you will be able to connect to the database when the upgrade is complete.

data.name: SqlFileConnectionVersionMismatch
data.value:
This database file is not compatible with the current instance of SQL Server.
To resolve this issue, you must upgrade the database file by creating a new data connection, or you must modify the existing connection to this database file.
For more information, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=235986

data.name: DataSource_SqlServerSpecifiedNotInstalled
data.value: The Data Source value in the connection string specifies an instance of SQL Server that is not installed. To resolve this issue, you can either choose to install the matching instance of SQL Server or modify the Data Source value in the connection string.
